content: everyday wrap designed by julie weisenberger this wrap is very easy to knit and surprisingly warm… enough to cut the chill at a restaurant or party be sure to knit it in your very favorite and most flattering color and you will reach for it often skills needed 2 skeins shibui silk cloud 60% the ruffle please buy an extra general knitting skills mohair 40% silk 330 yds/25g 100 yds of yarn or sizes two strands held together needles finished measurements flat 2 balls habu n-52 68% kid us 8 or 9 width at neck 17 mohair 32% nylon 311 change needle size if necessary to width at bottom 34 yds/0 5 oz obtain correct gauge length 13 2 balls a-171 naturally dyed cashmere 100% cashmere 187 gauge materials yds/0 5 oz 16 sts = 4 row gauge not important yarn options or 2 balls habu a-32b 60% mohair 400 yards of lace to sport weight abbreviations 40% silk 187 yds/0 5 oz yarn that gets gauge if you add see cocoknits com for complete or glossary of terms copyright © 2013 cocoknits com 2 cocoknits // everyday wrap directions co 52 sts and work in st st slipping the first st of optional ruffle each row work until piece measures 48 along the seam pu 52 sts loosely bobble all sts block lightly row 1 k1f&b each st 104 sts row 2 p now lay piece ws up in front of you with the co edge row 3 k1f&b each st 208 sts to your right and bobble edge to your left from the top row 4 bobble knitwise left corner measure 13 across top and mark from the co edge measure 17 and mark fold along the 17 mark with rs facing out now fold diagonally as indicated on schematics and sew co edge to side enjoy printed on recycled paper with soy based ink cocoknits com 3 the pattern and photographs contained in this document are the property of cocoknits this pattern is available for personal use
